decks.notes: The deck focuses on playing powerful creatures with good enter-the-battlefield effects while also having the ability to protect them with counterspells and removal. It aims to control the board early on with cards like Frilled Mystic and Deputy of Detention, then quickly overwhelm the opponent with big threats like Hydroid Krasis and God-Eternal Oketra. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, the Greathearted and Vivien, Champion of the Wilds to provide additional value and flexibility. It's a versatile aggro deck that can adapt to different situations and playstyles.

The main concept of this deck is to flood the battlefield with low-cost creatures and quickly overwhelm the opponent with sheer numbers. By playing efficient creatures like Snubhorn Sentry, Skymarcher Aspirant, and Benalish Marshal, the deck aims to build a strong board presence early on. Cards like Legion's Landing and History of Benalia help generate additional creatures and provide a continuous stream of threats. Conclave Tribunal and Baffling End offer removal options to clear the way for the aggressive creatures to attack. The inclusion of Venerated Loxodon and Ajani, Adversary of Tyrants further enhances the deck's ability to go wide and create a formidable army.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage. It utilizes cards like Thought Erasure, Disinformation Campaign, and Nicol Bolas to strip the opponent's hand and resources, while also using removal spells like Bedevil and Ritual of Soot to deal with threats on the board. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent through card advantage and powerful threats like Nicol Bolas, the Ravager and Nicol Bolas, Dragon-God, ultimately controlling the game until the opponent is overwhelmed.

This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on aggressive early game plays, utilizing a mix of efficient creatures like Knight of Malice, Knight of Grace, and Adanto Vanguard to quickly pressure the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Duress and Mortify to disrupt the opponent's game plan. As the game progresses, the deck can capitalize on its strong board presence with cards like History of Benalia and The Eldest Reborn. Finally, powerful planeswalkers like Liliana, Dreadhorde General and Gideon Blackblade provide additional threats and card advantage to close out the game.

The primary strategy of this deck is to maintain control of the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to stall out the opponent's threats, while building towards a win condition through powerful planeswalkers such as Teferi and Narset. Search for Azcanta helps to filter through the deck for key pieces, while cards like Time Wipe and Settle the Wreckage provide board wipes when needed. Ugin, the Ineffable offers additional removal options and Commence the Endgame can be a strong finisher. Overall, this deck focuses on outlasting opponents and overwhelming them with card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing various removal spells and counterspells to disrupt the opponent's strategy. With cards like Enter the God-Eternals, Tyrant's Scorn, and Vraska's Contempt, the deck can deal with threats efficiently. The inclusion of Liliana, Dreadhorde General provides card advantage and a win condition. Dreadhorde Invasion and Soul Diviner help generate value over time, while cards like Thought Erasure and Wizard's Retort provide disruption. The deck also utilizes God-Eternal Kefnet to copy powerful spells and finish the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by using powerful planeswalkers such as Liliana, Teferi, and Narset to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Removal spells like Kaya's Wrath, Vraska's Contempt, and Thought Erasure help keep the board clear while cards like Absorb and Dovin's Veto prevent the opponent from resolving key spells. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Chemister's Insight and Search for Azcanta to help maintain hand advantage and find important pieces. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through careful resource management and powerful control tools.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with low-cost, evasive creatures like Siren Stormtamer and Pteramander, while protecting them with spells like Dive Down and Wizard's Retort. Curious Obsession provides card draw and tempo advantage, while Tempest Djinn serves as a powerful late-game threat. The deck aims to maintain board control and pressure the opponent with aggressive creatures and countermagic, leveraging its mono blue color identity to maximize consistency and efficiency.

The main focus of this Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost aggressive creatures like Fanatical Firebrand, Ghitu Lavarunner, and Goblin Chainwhirler. Utilizing cards like Runaway Steam-Kin and Viashino Pyromancer to maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes burn spells such as Lightning Strike, Shock, and Wizard's Lightning to remove threats and deal direct damage to the opponent. Light Up the Stage and Risk Factor provide card advantage and The Flame of Keld offers a powerful late-game finisher. With a streamlined mana base of 20 Mountains, this deck aims to close out games quickly and decisively.

The main focus of this deck is to control the opponent's board by removing threats and disrupting their strategy with counterspells and hand disruption. The deck aims to stabilize the game with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Liliana, Dreadhorde General, while generating card advantage through Search for Azcanta and Thief of Sanity. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and Enter the God-Eternals to deal with any threats that slip through. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's three-color requirements.

This aggro Boros deck focuses on low-cost creatures with powerful ability triggers, backed up by a mix of combat tricks and removal spells to control the board. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Adanto Vanguard and Tenth District Legionnaire, while utilizing cards like Feather, the Redeemed to keep the pressure on. With a strong mix of creature power and spell versatility, this deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence and close out games swiftly.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of powerful creatures and planeswalkers to maintain board presence and pressure. By utilizing cards like Midnight Reaper and Massacre Girl for card advantage and board control, along with Wildgrowth Walker to gain life and Merfolk Branchwalker/Jadelight Ranger for card selection, the deck aims to outlast and outpace the opponent. The Golgari color combination also allows for a mix of removal, recursion, and ramp, providing versatility and flexibility in different matchups.

This deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption. The goal is to hinder the opponent's creatures and spells while building card advantage through card draw and graveyard interactions. Liliana, Dreadhorde General serves as both a win condition and a source of card advantage. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the board until it can establish a dominant position and clinch the game.

The key strategy of this deck is to aggressively play creatures like Wildgrowth Walker, Jadelight Ranger, and Merfolk Branchwalker to quickly build a board presence and gain incremental advantages. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Sorin and Vivien to provide additional utility and card advantage. Cards like Settle the Wreckage and Ixalan's Binding help control the opponent's board while cards like Shalai and Lyra provide protection and a strong finisher. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggressive creatures and versatile planeswalkers to secure victory.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively control the game by disrupting your opponent's hand with spells like Thought Erasure and Thief of Sanity, while also establishing a strong board presence with cards like Hero of Precinct One and Basilica Bell-Haunt. By combining aggressive creatures with versatile removal like Tyrant's Scorn and Deputy of Detention, as well as powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, this deck aims to keep the pressure on the opponent while controlling the game tempo.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing spells to counter opponent's plays, bounce threats back to their hand, and exile problematic permanents. It aims to stall the game with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler, while generating value with cards like Hydroid Krasis and Hero of Precinct One. The deck also includes removal spells like Settle the Wreckage and Deputy of Detention to deal with opposing threats, allowing the player to dictate the pace of the game.
